required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Increase of Handgrip Strength After the Use of Removable Partial Dentures.
clinical_study.official_title: Increase of Handgrip Strength After the Use of Removable Partial Dentures.

lead_sponsor.agency: Comisión Nacional de Investigación Científica y Tecnológica

clinical_study.source: Comisión Nacional de Investigación Científica y Tecnológica

brief_summary.textblock: A common goal of the health professions is to keep the elderly functional, preventing sarcopenia and frailty. Is there an association between handgrip strength in partially edentulous elderlies after completing their dentition with removable partial dentures?

detailed_description.textblock: A common goal of the health professions is to keep the elderly functional, preventing sarcopenia and frailty. Is there an association between handgrip strength in partially edentulous elderlies after completing their dentition with removable partial dentures?

primary_outcome.description: role of use of removable partial dentures (RPD) in handgrip strength in octogenarians

study_pop.textblock: Independent octogenarians that consulted in centers of the greater metropolitan area of Santiago, Chile, in search of solving their lack of posterior teeth with dental prostheses

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- agree to participate by signing the voluntary informed consent form
- qualify according to the Eichner Index in any of the categories that represent the loss of premolars and molars: B3-B4-C1-and C2.
Exclusion Criteria:
- not accepting to participate
- cognitive or auditory sensory impairment-
- being dependent in activities of daily living
- belonging to another category of the Eichner Index
